page.syntax: .Findby_definedkey([c title [,c prompt [,n type [,c expression_or_index_name [,l modeless [,c imagename ]]]]]])

argument.name: title
argument.description: Optional. Default = "Find by Key". The title of the dialog box.

argument.name: prompt
argument.description: Optional. Default = "Search for ". The prompt to appear next to the type-in field

item.name: 1 = The Expression argument is an index name.
2 = The Expression argument is an expression.

argument.name: expression_or_index_name
argument.description: Optional. Default = "". The tag name of an index or an Xbasic expression that selects records.

item.name: .T. = The dialog box is not modal.

argument.name: imagename
argument.description: Optional. Default = "$a5_find_by_key". The name of the function to call.

item.name: Browses (for <OBJECT> use either the <BROWSE> pointer or the name of the browse)
Forms (for <OBJECT> use either the <FORM> pointer or the name of the form)

section.description: The <OBJECT>.FINDBY_DEFINEDKEY() method is a high level approach to displaying the Find by Key dialog box that allows you to customize its appearance and preset its filter. Limitations: Desktop applications only.

section.title: Example
section.example: dim ptr as P ptr = form.load("Customer Information") ptr.show() ptr.FindBy_DefinedKey()
